intro: Nidorella floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive golden hue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Nidorella floribunda is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
